meanings.definition: The action of carrying something on or extending something.
meanings.sent1: The continuation of the movie kept us on the edge of our seats.
meanings.sent2: The continuation of the story left us wanting more.
meanings.sent3: The continuation of the game was so intense that we couldn't look away.
meanings.sent4: The continuation of the melody in the song was both soothing and captivating.
meanings.sent5: The continuation of the rain made the garden glisten with droplets.

meanings.definition: The act or state of continuing or persisting.
meanings.sent1: Her continuation in the dance class showed her dedication.
meanings.sent2: The continuation of the argument only led to more frustration.
meanings.sent3: The continuation of the joke had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The continuation of the music in the background added to the ambiance.
meanings.sent5: The continuation of the sunlight through the window warmed the room.

meanings.definition: The extension of something in time or space.
meanings.sent1: The continuation of the road seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent2: The continuation of the painting onto the next canvas was seamless.
meanings.sent3: The continuation of the line at the store made her consider leaving.
meanings.sent4: The continuation of the mountain range in the distance was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The continuation of the river into the horizon was a peaceful scene.
